io.straas.android.sdk.streaming.interfaces

Interface EventListener


  • public interface EventListener
    EventListener provides developer events about connection of a StreamManager. You could enable this listener by StreamManager.addEventListener(EventListener).

    All of these events would be invoked on UI thread.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onError(Exception error, String liveId)
      Called when an error occurs in streaming, that is StreamManager.getStreamState() returns StreamManager.STATE_STREAMING.
      void onError(StreamError error, String liveId)
      Deprecated. 
      Use onError(Exception, String) instead.
      void onFinished()
      Deprecated. 
      gets the result via the returned task of StreamManager.stopStreaming() or StreamManager.destroy().
      void onStreaming(String liveId)
      Deprecated. 
      gets the result via the returned task of StreamManager.startStreaming(String) or StreamManager.startStreaming(String, String, boolean, boolean).

    • Method Detail

      • onStreaming

        @Deprecated
void onStreaming(String liveId)
        Deprecated. gets the result via the returned task of StreamManager.startStreaming(String) or StreamManager.startStreaming(String, String, boolean, boolean).
        Called when streaming starts.
        Parameters:
        liveId - current streaming live event ID.

      • onFinished

        @Deprecated
void onFinished()
        Deprecated. gets the result via the returned task of StreamManager.stopStreaming() or StreamManager.destroy().
        Called when streaming is finished by invoking StreamManager.stopStreaming() or StreamManager.destroy().

      • onError

        @Deprecated
void onError(StreamError error,
                         String liveId)
        Deprecated. Use onError(Exception, String) instead.
        Called when an error occurs in streaming, that is StreamManager.getStreamState() returns StreamManager.STATE_STREAMING. In this case, live event won't be set to ended. If you want to end this event, you could use StreamManager.cleanLiveEvent(String)}.
        Parameters:
        error - error type, see error
        liveId - live event of current streaming

      • onError

        void onError(Exception error,
             String liveId)
        Called when an error occurs in streaming, that is StreamManager.getStreamState() returns StreamManager.STATE_STREAMING. In this case, live event won't be set to ended. If you want to end this event, you could use StreamManager.cleanLiveEvent(String)}.
        Parameters:
        error - failure reason
        liveId - live event id of current streaming
